results.abstract: The military tribunals originally barred public mention of what happened at C.I.A. prisons. Now a key question is what evidence terrorism suspects can use as the cases inch forward.

results.title: Waiting for Asylum in the United States, Migrants Live in Fear in Mexico
results.abstract: Hundreds of Central American migrants who are seeking asylum in the United States could soon be sent to wait in Mexico under a policy that has been expanded by the Trump administration.

results.title: Joe Biden Jokes About Hugging in a Speech, Then Offers a Mixed Apology
results.abstract: “I’m sorry I didn’t understand more,” Mr. Biden said about his hugs and kisses to women over the years. “I’m not sorry for any of my intentions.”

results.title: New U.S. Sanctions Seek to Block Venezuelan Oil Shipments to Cuba
results.abstract: The sanctions, senior administration officials said, could force a “recalibration” of Venezuela’s relationship with Cuba, which has been defending the government of President Nicolás Maduro.
results.byline: By ANNIE KARNI and NICHOLAS CASEY

multimedia.caption: A fisherman casts his net as an oil tanker sails in Venezuela. “Venezuela’s oil belongs to the Venezuelan people,” Vice President Mike Pence said, announcing sanctions.

results.title: Barr Orders Investigations of Discrimination at F.B.I. and Bureau of Prisons
results.abstract: The attorney general sought to allay concerns among members of a Justice Department group that advocates on behalf of gay, lesbian and transgender employees.

multimedia.caption: Justice Department employment decisions “must be made solely on merit and free from discrimination,” Attorney General William P. Barr wrote in a letter in which he vowed to fight discrimination of gay, lesbian or transgender employees at the department.

results.title: Education Department Has Stalled on Debt Relief for Defrauded Students
results.abstract: The Education Department failed to approve a single application for student loan relief in the second half of last year, according to new data, defying court orders.

multimedia.caption: Betsy DeVos, the education secretary, has attempted to narrow a rule that would have expanded and expedited a system for erasing federal loan debts for students who attended colleges that misled them with false claims and inflated data.

results.title: Bad Food, Broken-Down Trucks: What It’s Like to Be a U.S. Soldier on the Mexico Border

results.title: Modern Monetary Theory Finds an Embrace in an Unexpected Place: Wall Street
results.abstract: M.M.T.’s fans include Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Bernie Sanders — and financial analysts at Goldman Sachs, Nomura and GMO.

multimedia.caption: Money managers, chief executives and business analysts maintain that modern monetary theory offers important insights. Far from finding it fanciful or deranged, they are using M.M.T. to build economic forecasts and even trading strategies.

results.title: Trump Presses His Argument of a Border Crisis in California Visit
results.abstract: The president hailed what he said was the “tremendous impact” of the wall in Calexico, but in fact the part he visited was an upgrade to an existing section of fencing, not the kind of new construction he has called for.
